item.title: Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "In sorrow we must go, but not in despair. Behold! we are not bound for ever to the circles of the world, and beyond them is more than memory." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "We have come from God, and inevitably the myths woven by us, though they contain error, will also reflect a splintered fragment of the true light, the eternal truth that is with God. Indeed only by myth-making, only by becoming 'sub-creator' and inventing stories, can Man aspire to the state of perfection that he knew before the Fall. Our myths may be misguided, but they steer however shakily towards the true harbour, while materialistic 'progress' leads only to a yawning abyss and the Iron Crown of the power of evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Megan add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Megan add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Megan add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Megan add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Megan add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You come of the Lord Adam and the Lady Eve," said Aslan. "And that is both honour enough to erect the head of the poorest beggar, and shame enough to bow the shoulders of the greatest emperor on earth. Be content." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Megan add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it splendid to think of all the things there are to find out about? It just makes me feel glad to be alive--it's such an interesting world. It wouldn't be half so interesting if we know all about everything, would it? There'd be no scope for imagination then, would there?But am I talking too much? People are always telling me I do. Would you rather I didn't talk? If you say so I'll stop. I can STOP when I make up my mind to it, although it's difficult." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Megan add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "After all," Anne had said to Marilla once, "I believe the nicest and sweetest days are not those on which anything very splendid or wonderful or exciting happens but just those that bring simple little pleasures, following one another softly, like pearls slipping off a string." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Megan add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I'd like to add some beauty to life," said Anne dreamily. "I don't exactly want to make people KNOW more... though I know that IS the noblest ambition... but I'd love to make them have a pleasanter time because of me... to have some little joy or happy thought that would never have existed if I hadn't been born." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Megan add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Anne always remembered the silvery, peaceful beauty and fragrant calm of that night. It was the last night before sorrow touched her life; and no life is ever quite the same again when once that cold, sanctifying touch has been laid upon it." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Megan add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Megan add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "For a moment Anne's heart fluttered queerly and for the first time her eyes faltered under Gilbert's gaze and a rosy flush stained the paleness of her face. It was as if a veil that had hung before her inner consciousness had been lifted, giving to her view a revelation of unsuspected feelings and realities. Perhaps, after all, romance did not come into one's life with pomp and blare, like a gay knight riding down; perhaps it crept to one's side like an old friend through quiet ways; perhaps it revealed itself in seeming prose, until some sudden shaft of illumination flung athwart its pages betrayed the rhythm and the music, perhaps. . . perhaps. . .love unfolded naturally out of a beautiful friendship, as a golden-hearted rose slipping from its green sheath. " -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Megan add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "When I cannot write a poem, I bake biscuits and feel just as pleased." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Megan add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "The real things haven't changed. It is still best to be honest and truthful; to make the most of what we have; to be happy with simple pleasures; and have courage when things go wrong." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Megan add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is not everyone,' said Elinor, 'who has your passion for dead leaves." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A man does not recover from such devotion of the heart to such a woman! He ought not; he does not." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I cannot make speeches, Emma...If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more. But you know what I am. You hear nothing but truth from me. I have blamed you, and lectured you, and you have borne it as no other woman in England would have borne it." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I am sorry to tell you that I am getting very extravagant and spending all my money: and what is worse for you, I have been spending yours too. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description:
"Now be sincere; did you admire me for my impertinence?"
"For the liveliness of your mind, I did." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For I am the daughter of Elrond. I shall not go with him when he departs to the Havens: for mine is the choice of Luthien, and as she so have I chosen, both the sweet and the bitter." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair, and though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
